title: Build a simple ReactJS app
text: code saved file called faithful-app.R, can preview results calling functions: ’s ! ’ll use ts_compile() later create server code Typescript schema app.
code: cat(readLines('faithful-app.R'), sep = '\n') #> library(RserveTS) #>  #> get_hist <- ts_function( #>     function(bins = ts_integer(1)) { #>         h <- hist(faithful$waiting, breaks = bins, plot = FALSE) #>         data.frame(x = h$mids, y = h$density) #>     }, #>     result = ts_dataframe(x = ts_numeric(0), y = ts_numeric(0)) #> ) #> get_smoother <- ts_function( #>     function(bandwidth = ts_numeric(1)) { #>         d <- density(faithful$waiting, bw = bandwidth) #>         data.frame(x = d$x, y = d$y) #>     }, #>     result = ts_dataframe(x = ts_numeric(0), y = ts_numeric(0)) #> )  source('faithful-app.R') #> Loading required package: objectProperties #> Loading required package: objectSignals  get_hist$call(10) #>       x            y #> 1  42.5 0.0029411765 #> 2  47.5 0.0161764706 #> 3  52.5 0.0242647059 #> 4  57.5 0.0176470588 #> 5  62.5 0.0102941176 #> 6  67.5 0.0073529412 #> 7  72.5 0.0198529412 #> 8  77.5 0.0397058824 #> 9  82.5 0.0404411765 #> 10 87.5 0.0169117647 #> 11 92.5 0.0036764706 #> 12 97.5 0.0007352941

title: Build a simple ReactJS app
text: ’m using Vite create app, use framework. Whatever use, ’ll need able bundle code (including libraries zod). now able see default Vite app running http://localhost:5173 (similar, see console output). Now install rserve-ts zod packages:
code: pnpm create vite faithful-demo --template vanilla-ts cd faithful-demo pnpm install pnpm run dev pnpm install rserve-ts zod

title: Build a simple ReactJS app
text: now use ts_compile() function create two files: faithful-app.rserve.R file start Rserve instance apps functions available. faithful-app.rserve.ts contains TypeScript schema (using zod) let use R functions directly app like typescript function! ’ll send straight faithful-demo/src directory.

title: Build a simple ReactJS app
text: rest process simply requires writing TypeScript code. won’t go detail since ’s focus vignette, can see code written basic comments. Copy paste get app running.
code:
// main.ts import "./style.css"; import RserveClient from "rserve-ts"; import faithfulApp from "./faithful-app.rserve"; import { z } from "zod"; document.querySelector("#app")!.innerHTML = `

Rserve and TypeScript

Number of bins:
`; type FaithfulApp = z.infer>; let getHist: FaithfulApp["get_hist"] | undefined = undefined; async function connectToRserve() { const client = await RserveClient.create({ host: "ws://localhost:6311" }); const app = await client.ocap(faithfulApp); console.log("Connected to Rserve: ", app); getHist = app.get_hist; } connectToRserve(); document .querySelector("#counter")! .addEventListener("click", async () => { if (!getHist) return; const Nbin = parseInt( document.querySelector("#n")!.value ); const hist = await getHist(Nbin); const maxY = Math.max(...hist.y); const histDiv = document.querySelector("#hist")!; histDiv.innerHTML = ` ${Array.from(hist.y) .map( (yi) => `
` ) .join("")} `; }); // style.css :root { font-family: Inter, system-ui, Avenir, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.5; font-weight: 400; color-scheme: light dark; color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.87); background-color: #242424; font-synthesis: none; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale; } a { font-weight: 500; color: #646cff; text-decoration: inherit; } a:hover { color: #535bf2; } body { margin: 0; display: flex; place-items: center; min-width: 320px; min-height: 100vh; } h1 { font-size: 3.2em; line-height: 1.1; } #app { max-width: 1280px; margin: 0 auto; padding: 2rem; text-align: center; } .logo { height: 6em; padding: 1.5em; will-change: filter; transition: filter 300ms; } .logo:hover { filter: drop-shadow(0 0 2em #646cffaa); } .logo.vanilla:hover { filter: drop-shadow(0 0 2em #3178c6aa); } .card { padding: 2em; } .read-the-docs { color: #888; } button { border-radius: 8px; border: 1px solid transparent; padding: 0.6em 1.2em; font-size: 1em; font-weight: 500; font-family: inherit; background-color: #1a1a1a; cursor: pointer; transition: border-color 0.25s; } button:hover { border-color: #646cff; } button:focus, button:focus-visible { outline: 4px auto -webkit-focus-ring-color; } input { border-radius: 8px; border: 1px solid transparent; padding: 0.6em 1.2em; font-size: 1em; font-weight: 500; font-family: inherit; background-color: #1a1a1a; color: #fff; outline: none; } input:hover { border-color: #646cff; } input:focus, input:focus-visible { outline: 4px auto -webkit-focus-ring-color; } @media (prefers-color-scheme: light) { :root { color: #213547; background-color: #ffffff; } a:hover { color: #747bff; } button { background-color: #f9f9f9; } input { background-color: #f9f9f9; color: #000; } }

title: Build a simple ReactJS app
text: run app, start Rserve server: start Vite server: now able see app running http://localhost:5173 (similar, see console output).

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: Widgets RserveTS stateful objects can shared R TypeScript applications. provide: Reactive properties: Properties automatically synchronize R TypeScript Property handlers: Callbacks trigger properties change Hierarchical structure: Widgets can contain child widgets Type safety: Full TypeScript type definitions generated R code

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: example application demonstrates three interconnected widgets working iris dataset: Plot Control Widget (CtrlWidget): controller widget coordinates histogram barchart widgets Histogram Widget (HistogramWidget): Displays histogram selected variable interactive bar selection Barplot Widget (BarchartWidget): Shows species counts update based row selection

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: histogram widget allows users select variable number bins, displays resulting histogram. also supports interactive selection histogram bars filter data. Key features: Properties defined using ts_*() functions specify TypeScript types initialize function sets initial state property handlers Property handlers (addPropHandler) trigger callbacks properties change update() method recalculates histogram synchronizes state updateState() pushes changes TypeScript frontend
code: histogramWidget <- createWidget(     "HistogramWidget",     properties = list(         vars = ts_character(0L),           # Available variable names         var = ts_character(1L),             # Currently selected variable         nBin = ts_integer(1L),              # Number of bins         counts = ts_numeric(0L),            # Histogram counts         selectedBar = ts_integer(1L),      # Currently selected bar index         controller = "ANY"                 # Parent controller widget     ),     initialize = function(widget, parent = NULL) {         # Assign parent to controller property         if (!is.null(parent)) {             widget$controller <- parent         }          # Initialize available variables (excluding Species)         allvars <- names(iris)         widget$set("vars", allvars[allvars != "Species"])         widget$set("var", "")         widget$set("nBin", 10L)         widget$set("selectedBar", 0L)         widget$set("counts", numeric(0))          # Initial update         widget$update()          # Set up property handlers for reactive updates         widget$addPropHandler("var", function() widget$update())         widget$addPropHandler("nBin", function() widget$update())          # Handle bar selection to filter data         if (!is.null(widget$controller)) {             widget$addPropHandler("selectedBar", function() {                 x <- iris[[widget$var]]                 if (widget$selectedBar < 0) {                     widget$controller$set("selectedRows", seq_along(x))                     return()                 }                 br <- hist(x,                     seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = widget$nBin + 1L),                     plot = FALSE                 )$breaks                 i <- widget$selectedBar + 1                 xx <- which(x >= br[i] & x < br[i + 1])                 widget$controller$set("selectedRows", xx)             })         }     },     methods = list(         update = ts_function(             function() {                 if (.self$var == "") {                     return()                 }                 x <- iris[[.self$var]]                 h <- hist(x,                     seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = .self$nBin + 1L),                     plot = FALSE                 )                  # Update the front end                 .self$set("counts", as.numeric(h$counts))                  # Push changes through to UI                 .self$updateState()             }         )     ),     export = TRUE )

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: barplot widget displays species counts updates based row filtering controller. Key features: Uses ts_dataframe() define structured data typed columns Automatically updates subset property changes update() method recalculates counts filtered data
code: barchartWidget <- createWidget(     "BarchartWidget",     properties = list(         data = ts_dataframe(label = ts_character(0L), count = ts_integer(0L)),         subset = ts_integer()  # Row indices to include     ),     initialize = function(widget) {         widget$set("subset", seq_len(nrow(iris)))         widget$update()         widget$addPropHandler("subset", function() widget$update())     },     methods = list(         update = ts_function(             function() {                 tbl <- xtabs(~Species, data = iris[.self$subset, ]) |>                     as.data.frame() |>                     setNames(c("label", "count"))                  .self$set("data", tbl)                 .self$updateState()             }         )     ),     export = TRUE )

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: control widget coordinates histogram barplot widgets, managing row selection. Key features: Demonstrates hierarchical widgets: child widgets included properties histogram widget initialized controller parent Property handlers coordinate widgets
code: ctrlWidget <- createWidget(     "CtrlWidget",     properties = list(         selectedRows = ts_integer(0L),      # Selected row indices         histogram = histogramWidget,        # Child histogram widget         barchart = barchartWidget           # Child barplot widget     ),     initialize = function(widget) {         widget$set("selectedBin", 0)          # When rows are selected, update the barplot         widget$addPropHandler("selectedRows", function() {             widget$barchart$set("subset", widget$selectedRows)         })     },     methods = list(         histogram = ts_function(function() {         })     ),     export = TRUE )

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: ’ve defined widgets, need : Compile R code generate TypeScript schemas Deploy Rserve server run widgets

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: Use ts_compile() generate TypeScript schema Rserve deployment script: ts_compile() function: Reads R file identifies exported widgets (export = TRUE) Generates TypeScript type definitions using Zod schemas Creates Rserve deployment script using ts_deploy()
code: # Compile widgets.R to generate: # - widgets.rserve.ts (TypeScript schema) # - widgets.rserve.R (Rserve deployment script) ts_compile("widgets.R", filename = "widgets.rserve")

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: generated widgets.rserve.R file contains everything needed run Rserve server. can deploy using: deployment script: Loads required libraries (Rserve RserveTS) Sources widget definitions Exports widgets via ts_app() function Starts Rserve instance port 6311 (configurable) WebSocket support
code: # Option 1: Generate the deployment script and run manually ts_compile("widgets.R", filename = "widgets.rserve") Rscript widgets.rserve.R  # Option 2: Use ts_deploy() directly (generates and optionally runs) ts_deploy("widgets.R", file = "widgets.rserve.R", run = "no") Rscript widgets.rserve.R

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: ’s complete workflow:
code: library(RserveTS)  # 1. Define your widgets in widgets.R # (See widget definitions above)  # 2. Compile to generate TypeScript and Rserve files ts_compile("widgets.R", filename = "widgets.rserve")  # 3. Deploy the Rserve server # In a terminal: # Rscript widgets.rserve.R

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: create React application uses widgets, ’ll need : Set React project (e.g., using Vite) Install dependencies: rserve-ts, @tmelliott/react-rserve, zod Import generated TypeScript schema Use useRserve useWidget hooks @tmelliott/react-rserve can see live demo widgets working together : https://rserve-widgets-demo..railway.app/ demo showcases three widgets: Select variable adjust bins histogram Click histogram bars filter data See barplot update automatically based selection

title: Building Interactive Widgets with RserveTS
text: Widgets RserveTS provide powerful way build interactive applications synchronized state R TypeScript. Key concepts: Properties: Define widget state TypeScript types Initialize: Set initial state property handlers Methods: Define functions can called TypeScript Property Handlers: React property changes automatically Child Widgets: Build hierarchical widget structures Compilation: Generate TypeScript schemas ts_compile() Deployment: Run Rserve server Rscript generated .rserve.R file details creating React application uses widgets, including example code integration patterns, see documentation @tmelliott/react-rserve package. Note: detailed section creating React application widgets added future update vignette.

text: Tom Elliott. Author, maintainer.            Supported Ngā Puanga Pūtaiao Fellowships Government funding, administered Royal Society Te Apārangi, New Zealand.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Elliott T (2025). RserveTS: Deploy Rserve Applications Supporting TypeScript. R package version 0.7.2, http://tomelliott.co.nz/RserveTS/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RserveTS: Deploy Rserve Applications Supporting TypeScript},   author = {Tom Elliott},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.7.2},   url = {http://tomelliott.co.nz/RserveTS/}, }

title: Deploy Rserve Applications Supporting TypeScript
text: RserveTS package makes easy users write functions can used rserve-ts applications.

title: Deploy Rserve Applications Supporting TypeScript
text: can install development version RserveTS GitHub :

title: Deploy Rserve Applications Supporting TypeScript
text: Writing functions easy, just use ts_*() functions define formals return types. use ts_compile() generate TypeScript schemas: can import rserve-ts application. See tests/testthat/sampler example. also possible generate sourceable file deploy Rserve instance app code using ts_deploy():
code: # demo.R library(RserveTS) addFn <- ts_function(   function(a = ts_numeric(1), b = ts_numeric(1)) a + b,   result = ts_numeric(1) ) sampleFn <- ts_function(   function(x = ts_character(), n = ts_integer(1)) sample(x, n),   result = ts_character() ) app <- ts_function(   function() {     list(       add = addFn,       sample = sampleFn     )   },   result = ts_list(     add = addFn,     sample = sampleFn   ) )  # TODO: specify exactly which functions to export in the entry point # ts_export(app) import { Robj } from 'rserve-ts'; import { z } from 'zod';  const addFn = Robj.ocap([z.number(), z.number()], Robj.numeric(1)); const app = Robj.ocap([],   Robj.list({     add: Robj.ocap(),     sample: Robj.ocap()   }) ); const sampleFn = Robj.ocap(   [z.union([z.string(), z.array(z.string())]), z.number()],   Robj.character() );  export default {   addFn,   app,   sampleFn }; ts_deploy(app) # run with: Rscript app.rserve.R

title: Create a TypeScript-Compatible Widget — createWidget
text: Creates reference class-based widget can interact TypeScript code. widget supports reactive properties can observed R TypeScript, automatic state synchronization.

title: Create a TypeScript-Compatible Widget — createWidget
code: createWidget(   name,   properties = list(),   initialize = NULL,   methods = list(),   .env = parent.frame(),   ... )

title: Create a TypeScript-Compatible Widget — createWidget
text: name Character string specifying name widget class properties Named list typed properties widget. property TypeScript type object defines property's type initialize Optional initialization function receives widget instance sets initial state methods Named list methods add widget class. method ts_function object .env Environment ref class created. Defaults parent.frame() caller's environment (typically unlocked). Can overridden (e.g., .GlobalEnv) needed. ... Additional arguments passed TypeScript function constructor

title: Create a TypeScript-Compatible Widget — createWidget
text: TypeScript function constructor creates widget instances reactive properties methods TypeScript interoperability

title: Create a TypeScript-Compatible Widget — createWidget
text: Note object constructed takes Javascript setter function argument, calling obj$call() fail. created widget includes built-methods: set(prop, value): Set property value mark changed get(prop): Get property value addPropHandler(prop, fn): Register handler property changes updateState(= FALSE): Synchronize changed properties TypeScript property automatically gets TypeScript-accessible methods: register(fn): Register callback property changes get(): Get current property value set(x): Set property value

title: Create a TypeScript-Compatible Widget — createWidget
code: # Create a simple counter widget if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ createWidget(     name = "Counter",     properties = list(count = ts_integer(1)),     initialize = function(widget) {         widget$set("count", 0)     } ) } # }

title: Create Child Widget Connector — create_child_connector
text: Internal helper function create connector functions child widgets. Used add_child method tsWidget.

title: Create Child Widget Connector — create_child_connector
code: create_child_connector(   child_instance,   parent_instance,   property_name,   type_info,   widget_def )

title: Create Child Widget Connector — create_child_connector
text: child_instance child widget instance parent_instance parent widget instance property_name Name property containing child type_info Type information widget definition widget_def widget definition object

title: Create Child Widget Connector — create_child_connector
text: TypeScript function constructor child widget

JS functions callable from R — js_function
text: ... arguments passed function result type value returned JS R

Convert JavaScript Function to R Function — jsfun
text: x JavaScript function object

title: Convert JavaScript Function to R Function — jsfun
text: R function sends messages via Rserve

title: Base Widget Class — tsWidget-class
text: Base reference class widgets created createWidget. class provides core functionality reactive properties state synchronization TypeScript.

what: Generate an Rserve app from a ts function — ts_app
title: Generate an Rserve app from a ts function — ts_app
text: Anything function simply returns . However, functions wrapped Rserve::ocap(), result subsequently wrapped ts_app().

title: Generate an Rserve app from a ts function — ts_app
Generate an Rserve app from a ts function — ts_app
text: x ts function object (ts_function())

title: Generate an Rserve app from a ts function — ts_app
text: object class 'OCref', see Rserve::ocap()

title: Generate an Rserve app from a ts function — ts_app
code: f <- ts_function(function(x = ts_integer(1), y = ts_character(1)) {     x + nchar(y) }, result = ts_integer(1)) app <- ts_app(f) # class of 'OCref' # this can now be used in an Rserve application, for example

title: Array type — ts_array
text: array typed objects. zod, represented z.array(); returned objects must R lists, Robj.list().

title: Array type — ts_array
text: type input type, either zod-style string ("z.number()") ts_object.

title: Array type — ts_array
text: array object

title: Character or string type — ts_character
text: Strings represented Zod schema either string (z.string()), string array (z.array(z.string())).

title: Character or string type — ts_character
text: n length string vector. n = 1 single string expected. n = 0 length expected. n > 1 string vector length n expected.

title: Character or string type — ts_character
text: ts object accepts strings string vectors length n.

title: Compile R functions — ts_compile
text: Generates TypeScript schema given R function file path. path, R app also generated.

title: Compile R functions — ts_compile
text: f function file path ... Additional arguments (passed ts_deploy) name name function filename base file path write TypeScript schema R app (optional, uses [path f].rserve default). .R .ts file extensions appended automatically. "", output printed standard output console (see cat).

title: Compile R functions — ts_compile
text: Character vector TypeScript schema, NULL writing file

title: Typed dataframe — ts_dataframe
text: essentially list, elements must names length.

title: Typed dataframe — ts_dataframe
text: ... Named types.

title: Typed dataframe — ts_dataframe
text: ts object accepts data frames specified types.

title: Typed dataframe — ts_dataframe
code: x <- ts_dataframe(a = ts_integer(1), b = ts_character(1)) x$check(data.frame(a = 1L, b = "a")) #>   a b #> 1 1 a

what: Deploy a ts Rserve app — ts_deploy
title: Deploy a ts Rserve app — ts_deploy
text: Deploy ts Rserve app

title: Deploy a ts Rserve app — ts_deploy
code: ts_deploy(   f,   file = sprintf("%s.rserve.R", tools::file_path_sans_ext(f)),   init = NULL,   port = 6311,   run = c("no", "here", "background"),   silent = FALSE )

title: Deploy a ts Rserve app — ts_deploy
text: f path application files file file write deployment script init Names objects (ts_functions) make available initialisation function port port deploy app run Whether run deployment script, takes values "", "", "background" silent Whether print deployment script

title: Deploy a ts Rserve app — ts_deploy
text: NULL, called open Rserve instance

title: Typed factor — ts_factor
text: Factors integers labels. JS side, always represented string array (even one value - yay!).

title: Typed factor — ts_factor
text: levels character vector levels (optional).

title: Typed factor — ts_factor
text: ts object accepts factors specified levels.

title: Typed factor — ts_factor
code: x <- ts_factor(levels = c("a", "b")) x$check(factor("a", levels = c("a", "b"))) #> [1] a #> Levels: a b  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # this will fail x$check("a") x$check(factor("c", levels = c("a", "b", "c"))) } # }

title: TS function definition — ts_function
text: TS function definition

title: TS function definition — ts_function
text: f R function ... argument definitions (required f specify formals) result return type (ignored overloads provided) export TRUE, defined global namespace app compile time, function part initial functions available Rserve; otherwise need sent result another ocap.

title: TS function definition — ts_function
text: ts function object call method call function given arguments, checked type correctness.

title: TS function definition — ts_function
text: Defining functions core writing Rserve apps. Functions referred object capabilities (ocaps), 'objects' allow Javascript access capabilities R restricted interface. arguments can adjusted. TS functions can defined using existing (named) anonymous functions. Anonymous functions useful arguments functions can explicitly defined types formal arguments:

title: TS function definition — ts_function
code: f <- ts_function(function(x = ts_integer(1), y = ts_character(1)) {     x + nchar(y) }, result = ts_integer(1)) f$call(1, "hello") #> [1] 6

title: Integer type — ts_integer
text: Integers represented Zod schema either number (z.number()), Int32Array (z.instanceof(Int32Array)).

title: Integer type — ts_integer
text: n length integer vector. n = 1 single integer expected. n = 0 length expected. n > 1 integer vector length n expected.

title: Integer type — ts_integer
text: ts object accepts integer scalars vectors length n.

title: Integer type — ts_integer
code: x <- ts_integer(1) x$check(1L) #> [1] 1  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # this will fail x$check(1:10) } # }

title: Typed list — ts_list
text: list vector robjects, may may named.

title: Typed list — ts_list
text: ... list types, named unnamed.

title: Typed list — ts_list
text: ts object accepts lists specified types.

title: Typed list — ts_list
text: five types lists can define: Unknown list Known, named list (e.g., list(x = 1:5, y = 'hello world')). object JS. Known, unnamed list (e.g., list(1:5, 'hello world')). array JS. Named list single datatype (e.g., list(fit1 = lm(...), fit2 = lm(...), ...)), names length known ahead time. record<string, type> JS. Unnamed list single datatype (e.g., list(lm(...), lm(...), ...)), length unknown ahead time. Array JS.

title: Typed list — ts_list
code: x <- ts_list(a = ts_integer(1), b = ts_character(1)) x$check(list(a = 1L, b = "a")) #> $a #> [1] 1 #>  #> $b #> [1] "a" #>

title: Logical or boolean type — ts_logical
text: Booleans represented Zod schema either boolean (z.boolean()), typed Uint8Array (z.instanceof(Uint8Array)).

title: Logical or boolean type — ts_logical
text: n length boolean vector. n = 1 single boolean expected. n = 0 length expected. n > 1 boolean vector length n expected.

title: Logical or boolean type — ts_logical
text: ts object accepts logical scalars vectors length n.

title: Logical or boolean type — ts_logical
code: x <- ts_logical(1) x$check(TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # this will fail x$check(5) } # }

title: Null type — ts_null
text: type accepts NULL. function return types, use ts_void.

title: Null type — ts_null
text: ts object accepts NULL.

title: Numeric type — ts_numeric
text: Numbers represented Zod schema either number (z.number()), Float64Array (z.instanceof(Float64Array)).

title: Numeric type — ts_numeric
text: n length numeric vector. n = 1 single number expected. n = 0 length expected. n > 1 numeric vector length n expected.

title: Numeric type — ts_numeric
text: ts object accepts numeric scalars vectors length n.

title: Numeric type — ts_numeric
code: x <- ts_numeric(1) x$check(1) #> [1] 1  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # this will fail x$check(c(1, 2, 3)) x$check("a") } # }

title: Typed object (internal use only) — ts_object
text: base type typed objects, can used define custom types.

title: Typed object (internal use only) — ts_object
code: ts_object(   input_type = "any",   return_type = "any",   default = NULL,   check = function() stop("Not implemented"),   generic = FALSE )  is_ts_object(x)  get_type(x, which = c("input", "return"))  check_type(type, x)

title: Typed object (internal use only) — ts_object
text: input_type type object Typescript expect send R. return_type type object Typescript expects recieve R. default default value object. check function checks object returns valid. operates R side mostly development debugging purposes. developer ensure functions return correct type object always. generic logical, TRUE object generic type. x object type get, either "input" "return" type ts object

title: Typed object (internal use only) — ts_object
text: is_ts_object(): Check object ts object get_type(): Get input type ts object check_type(): Check object correct type

title: Optional type — ts_optional
text: wrapper around union type undefined

title: Optional type — ts_optional
text: type Type optional

title: Recursive list — ts_recursive_list
text: complex recursive lists. objects can contain subcomponents (parent) type. e.g., Person can name, dob, properties, 'children' (optional) array Person objects.

title: Recursive list — ts_recursive_list
text: values properties define base schema list; must named list. recur named list properties added. can use 'ts_self()' helper.

title: Recursive list — ts_recursive_list
text: ts object accepts recursive lists.

title: Recursive list — ts_recursive_list
text: Defining type Zod currently complicated, type pre-defined, extended manually defining Type. upcoming version zod 4, simplified. now, tricky.

title: Recursive list — ts_recursive_list
code: r_list <- ts_recursive_list(     list(name = ts_character(1)),     list(children = ts_self()) )

what: Types in R and TypeScript — type_objects
title: Types in R and TypeScript — type_objects
text: document provides overview main types available app developers, includes main types R TypeScript counterparts.

title: Types in R and TypeScript — type_objects
text: basic object RserveTS ts_object class. represented input return types, optional default value, checking function. Input types describe zod schema objects TypeScript can pass Rserve functions. Return types describe zod schema objects Rserve functions, utilise Robj utility types rserve-ts library. return types additional properties added, namedly r_type r_attributes, handled Robj utility types. Scalar versus array ("vector") types: R, almost types vectors. 'rserve-js' library, primitive arrays length one converted scalars, leads issues type checking , example, return value unknown length. (x > 5) one example. solve , add n argument ts_* functions. n = 1, type takes scalar form alue. n != 1, type takes array form value (includes 0). Otherwise, type union scalar array forms. case numbers, strings, booleans.

title: Types in R and TypeScript — type_objects
text: ts_boolean: boolean value. array type Int8Array. ts_integer: integer value. array type Int32Array. Javascript native integer type, scalars represented number (ts_numeric). ts_numeric: numeric value. array type Float64Array.* ts_string: string value. array type string[]. ts_factor: factor value. array type (level1 | level2 | ... | levelN)[], type scalar form. ts_list: list value, represented named object array. ts_dataframe: data frame value, represented named object. ts_null: null value. ts_void: void value, used specifying return types functions return value.

title: RserveTS 0.7.2
text: Fix bug JS type factors.

title: RserveTS 0.7.0
text: Enhanced createWidget() function support child widgets. Widgets can now contain widgets properties, enabling hierarchical widget structures. function now properly handles child widget initialization state management. Add objectSignals dependency Export tsWidget base class proper class lookup

title: RserveTS 0.6.0
text: Add new widget functionality simplify creating widget objects store state can modified JS application. node package @tmelliott/react-rserve contains hooks working widgets. fix bug (use inherits() instead class() == ““)

title: RserveTS 0.5.0
text: rename package ‘RserveTS’ make obvious package , avoid potential confusion “time series”
